Package core

Class SinglePlayerSession

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.SinglePlayerSession
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    class SinglePlayerSession
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Executes a single-player session where the player competes against the computer.

      • SinglePlayerSession

        public SinglePlayerSession​(java.net.Socket player,
                           java.io.ObjectOutputStream out,
                           java.io.ObjectInputStream in)
        Creates a new SinglePlayerSession object that initializes the player socket, communication streams, game logic, and computer player.
        Parameters:
        player - The player's socket.
        out - Output stream for the player.
        in - Input stream from the player.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Executes the single-player game session where the player competes against the computer. Manages the game flow by alternating turns between the player and the computer, processes moves, updates the game board, and notifies the player of game results (win, draw, or invalid moves). After the game ends, asks the player whether they wish to replay or exit. The method communicates with the player via input and output streams and leverages computer AI for automated gameplay.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • askToReplay

        private void askToReplay​(java.io.ObjectOutputStream out,
                         java.io.ObjectInputStream in)
                  throws java.io.IOException,
                         java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Prompts the player to decide if they wish to replay. Restarts the session if they agree.
        Parameters:
        out - Output stream for the player.
        in - Input stream from the player.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If communication with the client fails.
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - If an invalid object is received from the client.
